meanings.definition: Damage the reputation of (someone or something) in the opinion of others.
meanings.sent1: Gossip can besmirch a person's good name.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations served to besmirch his character.
meanings.sent3: Spreading rumors to besmirch someone is not a kind act.
meanings.sent4: The scandal managed to besmirch the once pristine image of the company.
meanings.sent5: The mudslinging campaign was designed to besmirch the opponent's reputation.

meanings.sent1: The mud from the garden besmirched her clean dress.
meanings.sent2: The dust storm besmirched the windows of the house.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy accidentally besmirched the white carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's spray paint besmirched the pristine wall.
meanings.sent5: The ink smudge besmirched the otherwise perfect document.
